metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16914 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The "stub_send_ret_submit()" function (drivers/usb/usbip/stub_tx.c) in the Linux Kernel before version 4.14.8, 4.9.71, 4.1.49, and 4.4.107 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a specially crafted USB over IP packet. It was discovered that the USB over IP implementation in the Linux kernel contained a NULL pointer dereference error. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16914` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
